questiontext.text:
A farm produces 4 types of fruit: lemons, pineapples, plums, and mangos. The fruits’ masses follow normal distributions, with parameters dependent on the type of fruit.

Type of fruit _ _ Mean mass (g) _ _ Standard deviation of mass (g) _
lemons 81 8
pineapples 1839 102
plums 88 8
mangos 239 20

One specimen of each type is weighed. The results are shown below.

specimen type _ _ Mass of specimen (g)
lemon 80.28
pineapple 1933
plum 85.36
mango 261.2
  1. Calculate a zz score for the lemon specimen. (Round to the nearest hundredth.) {1:NUMERICAL:=-0.09:0.011}
  2. What percent of lemons have less mass than the lemon specimen? {1:NUMERICAL:=0.4641:0.004}
  3. Calculate a zz score for the pineapple specimen. (Round to the nearest hundredth.) {1:NUMERICAL:=0.92:0.011}
  4. What percent of pineapples have less mass than the pineapple specimen? {1:NUMERICAL:=0.8212:0.004}
  5. Calculate a zz score for the plum specimen. (Round to the nearest hundredth.) {1:NUMERICAL:=-0.33:0.011}
  6. What percent of plums have less mass than the plum specimen? {1:NUMERICAL:=0.3707:0.004}
  7. Calculate a zz score for the mango specimen. (Round to the nearest hundredth.) {1:NUMERICAL:=1.11:0.011}
  8. What percent of mangos have less mass than the mango specimen? {1:NUMERICAL:=0.8665:0.004}
  9. {1:MULTICHOICE:%0%The lemon specimen is most unusually large.~%0%The pineapple specimen is most unusually large.~%0%The plum specimen is most unusually large.~%100%The mango specimen is most unusually large.}
  10. {1:MULTICHOICE:%0%The lemon specimen is most unusually small.~%0%The pineapple specimen is most unusually small.~%100%The plum specimen is most unusually small.~%0%The mango specimen is most unusually small.}
  11. {1:MULTICHOICE:%100%The lemon specimen is most typically sized.~%0%The pineapple specimen is most typically sized.~%0%The plum specimen is most typically sized.~%0%The mango specimen is most typically sized.}
  12. {1:MULTICHOICE:%0%The lemon specimen is most unusually sized.~%0%The pineapple specimen is most unusually sized.~%0%The plum specimen is most unusually sized.~%100%The mango specimen is most unusually sized.}

generalfeedback.text:
1. We use the formula for calculating the lemon specimen’s zz score. z=80.28−818=−0.09z = \frac{80.28-81}{8} = -0.09
  2. Use the zz table to find the percentile rank. P(Z<−0.09)=0.4641P(Z<-0.09) = 0.4641
  3. We use the formula for calculating the pineapple specimen’s zz score. z=1933−1839102=0.92z = \frac{1933-1839}{102} = 0.92
  4. Use the zz table to find the percentile rank. P(Z<0.92)=0.8212P(Z<0.92) = 0.8212
  5. We use the formula for calculating the plum specimen’s zz score. z=85.36−888=−0.33z = \frac{85.36-88}{8} = -0.33
  6. Use the zz table to find the percentile rank. P(Z<−0.33)=0.3707P(Z<-0.33) = 0.3707
  7. We use the formula for calculating the mango specimen’s zz score. z=261.2−23920=1.11z = \frac{261.2-239}{20} = 1.11
  8. Use the zz table to find the percentile rank. P(Z<1.11)=0.8665P(Z<1.11) = 0.8665
  9. We determine the maximum zz score is 1.111.11, which belongs to the mango. / . / . / .
  10. We determine the minimum zz score is −0.33-0.33, which belongs to the plum. / . / . / .
  11. We determine the minimum absolute zz score is 0.090.09, which belongs to the lemon. / . / . / .
  12. We determine the maximum absolute zz score is 1.111.11, which belongs to the mango. / . / . / .

questiontext.text:

Type of fruit _ _ Mean mass (g) _ _ Standard deviation of mass (g) _
watermelons 10000 1467
persimmons 202 13
bananas 189 22
mangos 297 22

One specimen of each type is weighed. The results are shown below.

specimen type _ _ Mass of specimen (g)
watermelon 10910
persimmon 184.3
banana 189.2
mango 323.6
  1. Calculate a zz score for the watermelon specimen. (Round to the nearest hundredth.) {1:NUMERICAL:=0.62:0.011}
  2. What percent of watermelons have less mass than the watermelon specimen? {1:NUMERICAL:=0.7324:0.004}
  3. Calculate a zz score for the persimmon specimen. (Round to the nearest hundredth.) {1:NUMERICAL:=-1.36:0.011}
  4. What percent of persimmons have less mass than the persimmon specimen? {1:NUMERICAL:=0.0869:0.004}
  5. Calculate a zz score for the banana specimen. (Round to the nearest hundredth.) {1:NUMERICAL:=0.01:0.011}
  6. What percent of bananas have less mass than the banana specimen? {1:NUMERICAL:=0.504:0.004}
  7. Calculate a zz score for the mango specimen. (Round to the nearest hundredth.) {1:NUMERICAL:=1.21:0.011}
  8. What percent of mangos have less mass than the mango specimen? {1:NUMERICAL:=0.8869:0.004}
  9. {1:MULTICHOICE:%0%The watermelon specimen is most unusually large.~%0%The persimmon specimen is most unusually large.~%0%The banana specimen is most unusually large.~%100%The mango specimen is most unusually large.}
  10. {1:MULTICHOICE:%0%The watermelon specimen is most unusually small.~%100%The persimmon specimen is most unusually small.~%0%The banana specimen is most unusually small.~%0%The mango specimen is most unusually small.}
  11. {1:MULTICHOICE:%0%The watermelon specimen is most typically sized.~%0%The persimmon specimen is most typically sized.~%100%The banana specimen is most typically sized.~%0%The mango specimen is most typically sized.}
  12. {1:MULTICHOICE:%0%The watermelon specimen is most unusually sized.~%100%The persimmon specimen is most unusually sized.~%0%The banana specimen is most unusually sized.~%0%The mango specimen is most unusually sized.}

generalfeedback.text:
1. We use the formula for calculating the watermelon specimen’s zz score. z=10910−100001467=0.62z = \frac{10910-10000}{1467} = 0.62
  2. Use the zz table to find the percentile rank. P(Z<0.62)=0.7324P(Z<0.62) = 0.7324
  3. We use the formula for calculating the persimmon specimen’s zz score. z=184.3−20213=−1.36z = \frac{184.3-202}{13} = -1.36
  4. Use the zz table to find the percentile rank. P(Z<−1.36)=0.0869P(Z<-1.36) = 0.0869
  5. We use the formula for calculating the banana specimen’s zz score. z=189.2−18922=0.01z = \frac{189.2-189}{22} = 0.01
  6. Use the zz table to find the percentile rank. P(Z<0.01)=0.504P(Z<0.01) = 0.504
  7. We use the formula for calculating the mango specimen’s zz score. z=323.6−29722=1.21z = \frac{323.6-297}{22} = 1.21
  8. Use the zz table to find the percentile rank. P(Z<1.21)=0.8869P(Z<1.21) = 0.8869
  9. We determine the maximum zz score is 1.211.21, which belongs to the mango. / . / . / .
  10. We determine the minimum zz score is −1.36-1.36, which belongs to the persimmon. / . / . / .
  11. We determine the minimum absolute zz score is 0.010.01, which belongs to the banana. / . / . / .
  12. We determine the maximum absolute zz score is 1.361.36, which belongs to the persimmon. / . / . / .
